learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of principles of operation, analysis and design of microwave passive and active circuits
Demonstrate knowledge of the role of passive and active microwave circuits in  wireless communication sub-systems
Perform a theoretical analysis of passive or active microwave circuits
Apply critical reasoning to microwave circuit design problems to obtain meaningful solutions
Creatively and efficiently utilize microwave simulation tools
Function as an effective member of a team to analyse and design microwave circuits with the use of CAD tools
Display ability to write clear and concise engineering reports at professional level
Demonstrate an ample knowledge of social and professional responsibilities

assessments.task_description:
You will be asked to:

Design microwave resonators using the principles covered in the Study Modules & Verify your design with the use of the microwave simulation tools available in the course. 

Design microwave filters using the principles covered in the relevant study modules & verify your design with the use of the microwave simulation tools available in the course.

Detailed tasks are shown in the documents available on the course website.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your Project Reports through the Blackboard submission system before 2:00pm (Brisbane Time).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: You will be asked to design microwave amplifiers using the principle covered in the study Modules. Next, you will be asked to verify your design with the use of the microwave simulation tools available in the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your Project Reports through the Blackboard submission system before 2:00pm (Brisbane Time).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The in-semester exam will be a closed-book exam. It will contain a mixture of short answer questions, design, and analytical questions.

This exam will assess material taken from week 1 to the exam date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description: You will be asked to design ​different types of microwave systems using the principles covered in the study modules. Next, you will be asked to verify your design with the use of the microwave simulation tools available in the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your Project Reports through the Blackboard submission system before 2:00pm (Brisbane Time).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
